text: I've been kind of addicted to cookies
lately and today I'm making one of my
new favorites it's a maple oatmeal tiny
little delicious crispy cookies you're
going to love them I have three cups of
oats in this bowl into that I'm adding 1
cup of all-purpose flour
quarter teaspoon of baking soda not
baking powder the baking soda and a
teaspoon of fine salt now usually I use
the for salt so this time it's the fine
salt if you do use coarse salt just go
ahead and use 2 teaspoons which seems
like a lot I know but it is half and
salty it's fine salt whisk it together
all right
so over here in my mixer I have 12
tablespoons of unsalted butter room temp
1 cup of light brown sugar and a half a
cup of granulated sugar needs to cream
so make sure that your butter is really
room temperature so it's nice and soft
but not melted when you're creaming with
brown sugar it doesn't get quite as
light and fluffy as it is when it's just
white sugar but it should get
significantly lighter scrape down the
bowl then add one egg I'm going to crack
it into a bowl this time because
somebody told me how they were cracking
directly into the bowl and the egg with
rock so now I'm cracking into a separate
bowl just like I always should have men
beat to combine then add a teaspoon of
vanilla extract 1/4 cup of maple syrup
hence the maple in name and a quarter
cup of water
I want to scrape down the sides one more
time and then you can add your dry
ingredients add the dry ingredients in
two additions just so that it combines
properly all right the rest can go in
and then just beat to combine as always
be careful when you're combining flour
so it doesn't fly all over you and by
that I mean start I'm home that's it
guys that's your dough if you don't have
a mixer you can totally make this by
hand or using a handheld mixer baking
sheet lined with parchment paper and a 1
teaspoon scoop if you have a ice cream
scoop that's one teaspoon go ahead and
use that because it's nice and even
otherwise just free handed it's totally
fine
it makes a lot of cookies because it's
one teaspoon so get ready to just start
scooping
have your oven preheating to 350 degrees
and bake your cookies for about 11
minutes until they're light golden brown
around the edges and set
let the cookies cool for about two
minutes on the pan then take them up and
put them on a cooling rack and this cute
crispy mmm
a white maple flavor so delicious make a
batch this weekend you will not regret
it in fact you're going to be like thank
you Sara
these are the best cookies cookie cookie
